Definition: In this task, you will be given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. When translating, keep the numbers and capital letters (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).

Positive Examples.input: Está, sin duda, dentro de la línea de las posiciones que nuestro Parlamento siempre ha adoptado.
Positive Examples.output: Indeed, it is quite in keeping with the positions this House has always adopted.
Positive Examples.explanation: This English sentence is properly translated into Spanish because the English sentence also talks about how the house was always adopted.

Positive Examples.input: Los servicios competentes no las han incluido en el orden del día por considerar que ya habían sido contestadas en una sesión anterior.
Positive Examples.output: The competent services have not included them in the agenda on the grounds that they had been answered in a previous part-session.
Positive Examples.explanation: This English sentence is properly translated into Spanish because the English sentence also talks about how the component service isn't included in the agenda because it was answered in previous session.

Positive Examples.input: Desearía que el Sr. Barón Crespo, autor de la petición, interviniera para justificarla, si a él le parece adecuado, por supuesto.
Positive Examples.output: I would like Mr Barón Crespo, who made the request, to speak to propose it. That is, if he so wishes, of course.
Positive Examples.explanation: This English sentence is properly translated into Spanish because the English sentence also talks about the person requesting Mr Baront to speak because he proposes it.

Negative Examples.input: Le confieso que, de momento, las cosas me parecen un tanto confusas.
Negative Examples.output: I admit that, at past, the matter seems to be somewhat confession.
Negative Examples.explanation: The conversion of Spanish to English is wrong because confusas means confused not confession.

Negative Examples.input: ¿Por qué tienen que beneficiarse los productores de armas de la UE a expensas de gente inocente?
Negative Examples.output: So why should EU arms producers profit at the expense of insane people?
Negative Examples.explanation: The conversion of Spanish to English is wrong because output translated inocente as insane. However, that should be innocent.

Negative Examples.input: Me gustaría que me asesorara sobre el Artículo 143 concerniente a la inadmisibilidad.

Negative Examples.explanation: The conversion of Spanish to English is wrong because it changes the number 143 to 145.

However, to focus on the European Union as it is today, and on the subject of government and governance - a word which, at least in Spanish, brings to mind the previous name of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, although it may be an appropriate word anyway -, the most important thing is that the European Union be provided with a good government, and, since President Prodi always defends his home town, Bologna, I would advise him to go to Siena for a while and see something which we all understand: the frescos of Ambrogio Lorenzetti, which speak of bon governo [good government] and mal governo [bad government].
